required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Ponseti Method Versus Older Treatments in Talipes Equinovarus Through Gait Analysis and Clinical Results
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Ponseti Method Versus Older Treatments in Talipes Equinovarus Through Gait Analysis and Clinical Results

brief_summary.textblock: There are many different treatments of congenital talipes equinovarus. At our institution, we use the Ponseti method with manipulation and immobilization of the foot. In our study we'd like to demonstrate the better outcome in clinical results and in gait analysis of patients treated with the Ponseti method, compared to the 'older' methods of taping and posteromedial release.

detailed_description.textblock: There are many different treatments of congenital talipes equinovarus. At our institution, we use the Ponseti method with manipulation and immobilization of the foot. In our study we'd like to demonstrate the better outcome in clinical results and in gait analysis of patients treated with the Ponseti method, compared to the 'older' methods of taping and posteromedial release. Trial objectives With this study we would like to investigate whether clinical results and gait analysis in patients treated with Ponseti has better results compared to patients treated with the older methods.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Resident working on this study left our department

primary_outcome.description: Different clinical results between the two groups using AOFAS score

secondary_outcome.description: Differences in gait analysis between the two groups. While walking barefoot following parameters will be compared: ranges of motion occurring at each joint and each sub phase of stance

arm_group.description: Children with clubfoots are treated by taping and posteromedial release
Children with clubfoots are treated by Ponseti

study_pop.textblock: Retrospective study of children with club foots treated by two different options.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients with talipes equinovarus who have been treated at our institution
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with other disorders which may influence the clinical or gait analysis outcome
